All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. In FY2014 and FY 2015 PCI will continue to strengthen the capacity of the Zambia Defence Force (ZDF) to implement evidence-based HIV/AIDS interventions that are prioritized in the 2009-2015 ZDF strategic plan and the 2013 Ministry of Health (MOH) treatment guidelines and in line with the 2011 PEPFAR Blueprint. PCI will strengthen the capacity of six ZDF facilities to provide life-long triple Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) regardless of CD4 count and clinical staging to all HIV positive pregnant women, HIV positive partners in serodicordant couples, children and adolescents below 15 years of age. PCI will foster strategic local partnerships and will leverage local resources to strengthen DFMS’ commodity management, laboratory, quality assurance, and community systems, and human resource capacity to enable the delivery of quality and sustainable services. PCI will support ZDF to engage health and community cadres and integrate mobile technology to increase access to early HIV testing and treatment and retention in care among infants, adolescents, men, and pregnant women. PCI will support ZDF to build a robust system to track clients’ retention in care overtime. PCI will continue to support ZDF to implement behavioral and gender based violence (GBV) prevention interventions targeted at the military personnel, youths and the civilian populations in and around ZDF units and will strengthen linkages between behavioral and biomedical interventions. PCI will support ZDF to implement economic empowerment and social protection programs for communities and families to strengthen their capacity to care for OVC. PCI will continue to promote ownership of the program by ZDF, by strengthening and mentoring the ZDF HIV/AIDS Secretariat to take a lead in program implementation.
